author: Cape Cod Times sports@capecodonline.com
title: School roundup: LaCasse
text: Posted Oct. 13, 2015 at 9:57 PM Updated Oct 13, 2015 at 9:58 PM By Cape Cod Times Posted Oct. 13, 2015 at 9:57 PM Updated Oct 13, 2015 at 9:58 PM » Social News BOURNE - Carly LaCasse scored three goals and the Bourne Canalmen shook off a tough defensive effort from Sturgis East early on to post a 4-0 field hockey victory on Tuesday afternoon. The game was scoreless until five minutes left in the first half when Annie Cheney set up LaCasse to give Bourne (7-4-1) a 1-0 lead at the intermission. The Canalmen scored a pair of quick goals in the second half with Delaney Hyldburg knocking home a rebound three minutes in and LaCasse making it 3-0 two minutes later. LaCasse completed her hat trick in the second half. Bella Powers excelled for Bourne in the midfield while Audrey Kelleher kept the Storm at bay defensively. Sturgis East goalie Cait Smith kept the deficit manageable with a strong game in net. Sandwich 5, Nauset 0: Junior Zoe Clarkin had a hat trick and added an assist, leading the Blue Knights past the injury-plagued Warriors in East Sandwich. Senior captain Anna Hurley had to work for her eighth shutout of the season, coming out of her circle to make a couple of late saves to preserve the clean sheet. Hurley got strong help on defense from sophomore Anne Davis particularly down the stretch. Sandwich (9-1-1, 4-0 Atlantic Coast League) qualified for the South Sectional tournament with the win. Junior Sam Souke gave Hurley all the offense she would need, knocking home a pass from senior Carly Whittle just five minutes in. Whittle again set up a goal, this time for Clarkin, with the junior adding her second goal before the half for a 3-0 lead. Senior Sarah Condon made it 4-0 10 minutes after the break with Clarkin completing her hat trick with 12 minutes to play. Playing without league-leading scorer Emma Stevens, who is suffering from concussion issues, junior Lucy McNamara had a phenomenal game in net recording 37 saves for Nauset (4-7-1, 0-5 ACL) while Tanner Deegan was strong on defense. Monomoy 5, Carver 0: Senior Brooke Wrightington sparked the Sharks offense with a hat trick as Monomoy clinched a berth in the South Sectional tournament with a win in Carver. Emma Mawn got the Sharks (10-2, 8-1 South Shore League) going on an assist from Marina Small in the first half. Wrightington then doubled the lead with an individual effort tally before the half. Wrightington made it 3-0 early in the second half, on an assist from Caroline Howard) before Small knocked home her second, on an assist from Carly Donovan, and Wrightington finished her hat trick on another individual effort tally. Wrightington’s hat trick gives the senior 30 goals on the season to go along with eight assists. Monomoy got strong play on defense from Small and Sarah Osborne, while Wrightington was key all over the field. BOYS GOLF Sandwich hands Nauset first loss: Mithran Denbow shot a 1-under 34 at The Ridge Club in Sandwich to help the Blue Knights hand the Nauset Warriors their first loss of the season, 233-237. Nauset entered the day 12-0 and 7-0 in the Atlantic Coast League. Sandwich is now 11-4, 6-1 in the ACL. A win at Falmouth on Thursday would help the Blue Knights to share of the league title with the Warriors. Jake Raye added a 36 for Sandwich while Justin Turbeville shot a 38, Paul Glynn a 41 and Hunter Dees and Alec Abramson both shot 42s. Andrew Flynn and Charlie Campbell led Nauset with 37s. Mashpee qualifies for D-3 Qualifier: The Falcons swept both sides of a tri-meet with Cape foes St. John Paul II and Nantucket to keep their unblemished record of never failing to qualify for the South Sectionals since the school opened in 1996. The Falcons improved to 11-6 with the wins in matches played at Falmouth Country Club’s Championship Course front nine. The match was originally scheduled to be played at Quashnet Valley Country Club, but Tuesday’s torrential downpours in the morning left the course unplayable. Mashpee defeated Nantucket 38½-15½ and at the same time topped St. John Paul II, 36-18. Leading the way for the Falcons were their top two players, Jake Curtin and Jacob Marques, each shooting a 41 over the par-36 layout. By Cape Cod Times
